meanings.sent1: She primped in front of the mirror before the party.
meanings.sent2: He primped his hair before the job interview.
meanings.sent3: The cat primped its fur with meticulous attention.
meanings.sent4: The flower primped its petals in the morning sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The actor primped backstage, preparing for the show.

meanings.definition: To make oneself neat and tidy
meanings.sent1: After the rain, she primped her clothes to look presentable.
meanings.sent2: He primped his desk before the important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel primped its nest with fresh leaves.
meanings.sent4: The chef primped the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent5: The student primped their notes for the exam.

meanings.definition: To spend time making oneself look attractive
meanings.sent1: She primped for hours before the date.
meanings.sent2: He primped his outfit for the special occasion.
meanings.sent3: The bird primped its feathers to impress a potential mate.
meanings.sent4: The model primped on the runway, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The bride primped in anticipation of her wedding day.
